content.description: This somewhat contrived climb ascends the face between the dihedral of The Box and the Diagonal crack. Climb the slab to the ledge at the bottom of the Diagonal crack (the same start as for Diagonal.) Climb the face left of The Box dihedral and right of Diagonal's crack without using the right face of The Box or the Dihedral crack.It features interesting moves on slopey footholds. Thick calluses reduce the pain caused by the point of an old broken piton in a key hold.
content.location: The start is the same as Diagonal. Climb the slab to the ledge at the bottom of the Diagonal Crack and the base of The Box dihedral.

content.description: Same start & finish as Lost Arrow but use only the right facing thin crack and pin scars to the top. Avoid using left facing corner.<iframe width="690" height="388" src="youtube.com/embed/KUiooAR0J…; frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
content.protection: Typical great falls TR anchor. Lots of trees and natural pro.
content.location: Same location as Lost Arrow (Between "The Strain" and "Splinters")

content.description: Start on either P.V.O or "Lost Arrow" and head up to the crack between the two.
content.protection: Typical great falls TR anchor. Lots of trees and natural pro.

content.description: A nice route in the middle of the Aid Box area.  A few awkward moves down low and there are a couple of ways to get through it.  Moves up to a right facing corner and then a quick finish.
content.protection: Top Rope.  Like everywhere at GF you'll need plenty of rope or webbing to build anchors off of trees.
content.location: To the left of Lost Arrow under the right facing corner.  Kind of in the middle of the belay ramp.

content.description: Short but reachy route. Tougher at top.
content.protection: Typical great falls TR anchor. Lots of trees and natural pro.
content.location: 5 Feet left of "Dark Corner". Wall faces up-river. Follow crack up and left.

content.description: Start below and right of the amphitheater's large right facing corner to the left of Lost Arrow. Climb the ramp to the face just right of the corner and left of Splinters. Climb the face and bulge above.

climbs.name: Pythagoras Was Not a Climber
climbs.fa: Unknown. Recorded ascents by Mark Nord in 2010

content.description: This variation on the popular route, Diagonal, takes the other two sides of the triangle of which the Diagonal crack is the hypotenuse. Start is the same as Diagonal, up the initial slab. From there, head left and gently up about 15 feet on a good under-cling and small horizontals. A few feet before reaching the Monkey Fingers crack, from a good horizontal, head straight up. Top-out is a few feet left of the top of Diagonal, whence you can continue right along the top to the anchors. I have seen a strong climber go up a few feet further right, completing a more perfect triangle.
content.location: Start is up the initial slab of Diagonal to the ledge at the bottom of the Diagonal crack and also the bottom of The Box.

content.description: Start at the thin crack under the left part of the roof. Climb the crack to the roof and pull it. Follow the left-facing flake to the top.
content.protection: Typical great falls TR anchor. Lots of trees and natural pro.
content.location: On the upstream face find a thin crack that takes you under the left side of the overhang then through to the left and finish straight up.

content.description: 10 feet to the right of the overhang on the upstream face. Be sure to climb face and not thin crack to the right.
content.protection: Typical great falls TR anchor. Lots of trees and natural pro.

content.description: The climb ascends the blunt arête halfway between Dark Corner and Monkey Fingers. Mark Nord worked this route off and on for several years and finally sent shortly after Ethan. Being unaware of the FA, Mark proposed the name Illumination Arete, but also likes Ethan's Monkey Paws. It is like bouldering on a rope. There are two hard sequences. A tall person may be able to reach the top hold without doing the top hard sequence, which would lower the grade two or three notches.
content.protection: Top rope requires long webs to avoid a possible long swing.
content.location: Start below the blunt arête halfway between Monkey Fingers and Dark Corner in the Aid Box sector of Great Falls Park.

content.protection: Typical great falls TR anchor. Lots of trees and natural pro.
content.location: Start approx 15 feet left of the corner of "The Box".

content.description: For me this is one of the best climbs at Great Falls. Climb the obvious pin scarred crack using the small left facing dihedral on your right. Crux is grasping the holds on the left facing dihedral and moving beyond them. It is supposedly 5.11 if you go straight up the crack without the dihedral. Add a few letter grades for a mid-summer, humid-as-hell ascent :)<iframe width="690" height="388" src="youtube.com/embed/KUiooAR0J…; frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
content.protection:
Typically a TR, but one could lead this crack.  A few cams and a set of nuts would be sufficient.  Offset cams/nuts would work better in the pin scars.  Plenty of trees for a TR setup, but also a nice crack for cams/nuts if you don't have enough long slings.   

  FYI:  I've never actually seen anyone leading here and not sure how well pro holds in the rock.
content.location: In the Aid Box just left of the PV overhang.

content.description: Start same as Skidrow.    Climb the face without using the crack.
Go up the low angled start of the Box, then head left to the base of the crack. Crank up on some decent locks and tricky feet to the top.
content.protection: This would be an exciting lead, on small gear that would go in the same places you'd want your fingers. Most will be happy for the TR, but bring long slings, the trees are about 20-30 feet from the edge.
content.location: Just left of the Box, the prominent corner on the cliff, and to the right of the thin seam of Monkey Fingers. The right to left diagonal finger crack should be obvious.

content.description: Easy and great for beginners. Large flakes provide good holds.
content.protection: Plenty of trees for TRSet of nuts with optional small cams
content.location: Slightly downstream of Aid Box. About 30 feet left of "The Box" and 15 feet left of "Monkey Fingers.

content.description: Starts on an awkward sloping ramp and then up into a large right facing corner.  There's a large ledge halfway up on the right.
content.location: In between Diagonal and Splinters in the deepest corner in Aid Box.

content.description: The Aid Box is a small rock amphitheater located about 200 yards downstream of Juliet's Balcony. It is the most popular area at Great Falls and contains many excellent climbs from moderate to extremely difficult.
